document_data.mainbody:
'''Parrots''', or "'''pair-rots'''", as eloquently put by [[Volothamp Geddarm]], was a collective name given to a variety of exotic brightly colored, sometimes talking, [[bird]]s native to [[south Faer√ªn]],
{{quote|''But think of the parrot, [[Gultec]]. Think of the bright feathers, the strong wings, the sharp, hooked beak, the powerful claws. Think of these things!''|[[Zochimaloc]], the ruler of [[Tulom-Itzi]]}}
document_data.Description:
[[File:Parrot limb dexterity.png|328x328px|thumb|''A parrot demonstrating its strong wings and dexterous talons.'']]
Parrots varied in size but most had brightly colored plumage, of brilliant greens, reds, golds, and blues, with large strong wings and sharp talons and beaks.
document_data.Abilities: Parrots' four-toed claws allowed them to hold and use relatively small or light magic items, such as [[ring]]s, [[wand]]s, or other [[enchanted]] knickknacks. This, along with their ability to speak or parrot languages, made them a popular creature to be domesticated, trained, or made into a [[familiar]].{{Cite dragon/280/A Little More Familiar|42}}

Ecology.Usages:
[[Barbarian]]s of the southern lands sometimes used parrot feathers as decorations. The quills from parrots could also be fashioned into good hairpins, and colorful parrot feathers could be sold as a commodity in the lands where these birds were exotic. Each feather could be valued at one to four [[silver]] [[coin]]s there. ''[[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]]'' sold parrot feathers in its Tailor's Corner section for three silver pieces per feather.

Parrot feathers also could be used in fletching, making good-quality [[arrow]]s.

document_data.History:
[[File:Polly NWN1.jpg|thumb|''[[Polly]], the stuffed bird of [[Torleth's Treasures]] in [[Gillian's Hill]].''|311x311px]]
[[Aliah]], the famously beautiful princess of Payit in Maztica, wore a cascading floating cape of blue, green, and red parrot feathers during the marriage ceremony to her half-brother, [[Xetl]]. The wedding ended in tragedy, and her death signaled the end of the [[Golden Age of Payit]].

During his venture to [[Samarach]] in the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, famed author Volo sought to purchase an exotic creature known as "pair-rots". He was unable to acquire one from the town's markets after being barred entry following a "misunderstanding" over something he called "powdered beard of [[Elminster]]". Volo loved the idea of a talking pet and thought it would make a grand companion.
document_data.Notable Species:
*[[Macaw]], big, bright, and loud parrots found in [[Dambrath]], [[Calim Empire]], and Maztica.
*[[Parakeet]], small yellow-feathered boisterous bird found in the Malatran Plateau{{Cite organized play/LJ/On the Lookout!|3}} and [[Zakhara]].{{Cite dungeon/47/The Assassin Within|64}}
